item.title: Report X-2025041834
item.description:
Report X-2025041834

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-19
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE FAILED ON UNLOADING LINE 7. SORTER WAS ABLE TO TURN BOX WITHOUT TOUCHING CONTENTS AND PLACE THE PACKAGE ON THE GROUND. DMP RESPODED TO THE PACKAGE WITH DECISION TREE AND PROPPER PPE. PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO DMP AREA AND THEN PROCESSED ACORDING TO THE CORROSIVE SOLIDS RESPONSE SHEETS.

item.title: Report X-2025041364
item.description:
Report X-2025041364

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-14
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO OF DELAWARE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO PD1 FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND FLAMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET RESPONDER PLACED LEAKING PACKAGE IN SPILL TUB AND CLEANED UP SPILL. THE LEAKER AND CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025040583
item.description:
Report E-2025040583

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-28
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 1-gallon plastic pails due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pails being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer and dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025041387
item.description:
Report X-2025041387

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-18
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Facility personnel reported a leak from IM tank RMCU10056. Upon investigation by a contractor it was determined the leak was the result of the Manway Gasket not properly installed which allowed product to leak out when lifted from chassis prior to loading into railroad well car.
